intro: Norantea guianensis subsp. japurensis, commonly known as the Japurensis norantea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found near rivers and in swampy areas. Its leaves are broad and palmately lobed, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
